channel.title: Awesome. Just awesome
channel.description:
I just installed Kubuntu for the first time in about 6 months, and the new installation is awesome. I had no idea the installation was re-done. I was expecting the old blue background white text etc. install. I like how it is a live CD, with a shortcut on the desktop to actually intall it. That's just an awesome idea.
Sorry if this is spam :D. I just think they had the right idea with this one. Somehow, they still managed to make it even [i]more[/i] user friendly.

item.title: Awesome. Just awesome
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Yep, I bet my 7 year old brother could install it.

I’m using Linux right now (duel boot Linux + Windows), and I’m suprised I still remember some things. So I went to ati.com to download a driver for my graphics card (Ati MobilityRadeon X300). So, I ran the intall (I’m surprised I remembered the sh command), and if I remember right, it creates an xorg.conf file somewhere besides your X11 folder, that has all the info for the graphic card. Where does it save it? I need to replace it with my new one that the driver intaller created, but I don’t know where it saved it. Any help on this?

Read full topic

item.title: Awesome. Just awesome
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

Argh yeah, the first Linux I installed was Slackware 3.5 (I still have the CDs =D), and a few before, and the installer… isn’t friendly =P.
Nice to see how it’s massive evolved in terms of user friendliness.

Read full topic
